tags.name: Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore (MINDS)

comments.message: Please be grateful!!!! If you think this is not a good meal go donate food for them and post for us to see.Why wanna complaint about it if you yourself are not doing it.

@Daniel Seah 
There are always better ways to help and trust me, it will never be enough and it will never please everybody. 
Every small act of good deed ought to be appreciated and not pointing fault at all. Sometimes, people who make negative comments tend to be those who hardly do good deeds at all. 
Let's rejoice since Mcd has done their little part in bringing joy to the children and perhaps you can prepare your cheque book and contribute the cash MINDS need.
Please serve them better food other than your breakfast. They deserve better

If corn, apple slices and less sweetened Ribena is unhealthy, I don't know what constitutes healthy. ;-)  do check up what Macs provided before your criticism. 

http://www.mypaper.com.sg/news/mcds-minion-frenzy-nets-meals-charity-20130730

I think his intentions meant well too looking at the high obesity rate in the consumption of too much fast food in USA .. Etc .. So can't really put him down .. But these kids will surely have a jolly good time in these short once in a blue moon kind of happy meal times too:) so lets give these kids a break too given their high metabolic rate and also be thankful that mcdonalds had donated those happy meals instead of customers dumping them .. Eat in moderation remember:) cheers peace peace people:)
Mcd menu has gone more healthier den before. With corn cup, apple slice, grilled chicken, less sweet ribena n etc. It promotes more balanced meal den before.
I support MINDS
Yes, maybe if you are taking about 4 pcs of nuggets, I understand... Give them an occasional break la... Like that char kway teow stores should shut down
Totally agree with you, Karen Soh. Some just like to talk only but do nothing..
Finally you put this up :) Nice! Great to see that they are all having a wonderful National Day! Keep it going MCD SG!
sometimes junk food can bring alot smiles & fun time. junk food is classified unhealthy food but a big smile melts a heart.
Keep up the good work!
Unhealthy comment is worse then * unhealthy food~~just follow ur * Heart, everybody mean *Good ^^¥
The happy meal donations should still go on!
Please stop serving kids junk food

Guys,I am not complaining at all. Instead,I am pointing out that these children deserve better other than giving them mcd meals. They can convert these meals to money which can help them in a long way instead of feeding them junk food. I do appreciate mcd efforts but they will have to try harder to enhance their CSR image

IMHO, I disagree with Dah Kiwoo that "Singaporean sure loves to complain". I think Daniel Seah is not really complaining but his intention is good and just being concern for kids at MINDS. Too much of High calories food is definitely not good regardless of brand or food. I am sure MINDS have several activities for the kids to have fun that day to burnt it all out. For me, I am glad to see the kids celebrating NDP with a smile enjoying their meal. 

Let's share their happy moments with just words of Happiness here and nothing else. 

I think the calories for donated meal is:
4 pcs nugget - 190 cal
Corn - 152 cal
Ribena less sweet - 74 cal
They were students from MINDS Lee Kong Chian Gardens 👍
Totally agree with you dah kiwoo!! These people has got no life!! Only know how to complaint

Mark Xlii @Goh Tong Seng I am not sure what kind of suffering you had gone through but hope you would recover from it. However, your posting is really inconsiderate, if this is not an intended post from you, hope you could remove it.
I support MINDS
I really hope all this money really go to them... They really need this money...

Yeah...true...disabled people should be helped, but perfect people should be opposed, and evil people who DO harm to others, should be banished!! But how come many can't accept their broken ego that they are nOt perfect and inferiors?! ;D

@Goh Tong Seng. Thank you for removing your comment that you posted. Please do take good care. And if you have something in your heart that trouble you. Speak to your close friend. You be surprise what it does when you share with them. Live Happy. Cheers
$69,000 still NOT enough for the charity. ... McDonald should donate more...... than $69,000

0.post_text: Thank you all for your generosity and kind heartedness! We’ve received over 5000 Happy Meal donations and have collected $69,000 in cash donations from the sale of our Prosperity Meals earlier this year. All proceeds will be given to our charity partner, the Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore (MINDS)!

3.post_text: ‘LIKE’ if any of these burgers are your favourite!

comments.message: Hi everyone and thank you for your interest in our latest McAloo Tikki burger! To clarify, the potato burger contains a potato patty, a slice of tomato, onions and mayonnaise sauce, sandwiched between two buns. It’s prepared side by side with other products that are non-vegetarian and may not be suitable for all vegetarians.
We would like this to be a permanent feature in the menu...the indian community is thrilled for this gift on our national day...thank you again
I HATED IT. Worst burger ever. Took 3 bites and I couldn't bear to eat it anymore. The peas tasted bad and just...ewwww. BURGERS NEED MEAT.
If McDonald's can make this a total vegetarian burger and prepare it separately I'm sure alot more vegetarians will eat it.

If this burger sucks, the people who don't like it don't have to eat it. Those who eat non vegetarian food have countless options for eating out. Think about the vegetarians. This would truly be something good with the kind of availability Mcdonalds can give as they are located all over Singapore.
Should make it a permanent menu, there are many vegetarians in Singapore, hope macdonalds can support this community. :)
Mcdonald should have menu for vegetarian:)
This burger sucks. Can you please please PLEASE bring back "Grilled Chicken Foldover"??
My neighbour call this burger "Hello Kitty". But it taste good! MCD SG, Please keep for longer than limited time.

Please Mcdonalds Singapore. Continue having this on your menu. Finally we vegetarians got something to eat in Singapore's most popular fast food restaurant chains. Finally my kids can celebrate their birthdays at Mcdonalds with something to eat. Many Mcdonalds in other international countries have vegetarian options. Singapore has a fair amount if vegetarians & vegetarians by choice who eat only vegetarian on some days. It would be a boon for us all.

It's terrible that all these vegetarians are jumping up in excitement for the chance to throw their money away to a huge animal slaughtering organisation like McDonalds. A sad day for true vegetarians around the world.

I wish I could sincerely say I'm pleased with the introduction of the new aloo tikki burger. However I cannot help but feel this is a pathetic attempt to reach out to the growing number of indian expats here, whom are largely vegetarian. This is definitely by no means a burger for the "vegetarians". Is it mere co incidence that you choose to release the burger on India's Independence Day? C'mon McDonald's, if you really wanted to make us vegetarians feel included, you could've come up with some veggie burgers a long time ago. It saddens me that you go all out to make the foreigners feel included, while neglecting the s'poreans who have been here all along. And I really wish more people could see through your scam.
It shld be on the menu permanently n not for limited time. At least then vegetarians can enjoy with their families at McDonald's. Just a thought ;)
Right on Indian Independence Day. Thank you McDonalds SG!
finally! something for vegeterian! juz take out the onions...gd job mcdonalds! :)
Am so glad vegetarian has a choice of burger too! Thank you, McD!
The worst burger ever

McDonald Singapore team- a big thank you for bringing the McAloo tikki burger on the menu!! I loved it!! Absolutely consistent to what is served in India it was not just "craving a saving" but much much more because of the nostalgia value. It might be cooked along with other non-vegetarian food but is still a "meatless- vegetarian" option for most people in Singapore. Please do consider upgrading it to the "unlimited period" menu. Thanks again.
Shd have this permanently on menu instead of limited period. Vegetarian who wants,pure vegan burger can visit veganburg though

It tastes like A Loo, soggy soaked w oil n not crispy crusted. Even the bun managed to help w absorbing the oil. 
Tried at three diff outlets w same results, disappointing.
Is there any way to block this nonsense? This isn't food. It's poison.
Really happy that macs is looking into vegetarian options. Hope to see it on the permanent menu!! :))
They should put lettuce instead of onions.
Lousy burger.. Get rid of it!!
Thank you Singapore McD for introducing this delicious and YUMMY YUMMY dish or food for VEGANs like me to enjoy

For a limited time only. Find out more at http://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/everydaysaversmenu

love the ads :)

What a joke! You guys are running a campaign on love & grandparents (http://www.meetsharelove.com/) when one of your staff was particularly rude to my mine?

My 90 y'old grandma walked up to the counter and asked a staff for help to throw a cup away because she couldn't find the trash bin(she's 90% blind). YOUR STAFF, slammed the cup down in annoyance not once but twice because she had to do extra work. 

What kind of nonsensical service are you teaching your staff? I mean, she ordered a drink and instead of leaving the cup on the table for your staff to clean up, she did you a favor and brought it to you. Plus to react this way to an elderly? I'm pretty sure that's not what your current campaign is try to imply.

What's the size of the toy

Just to share and William is right, best is to read the FAQ and T&C on the websit......IMPORTANT: After you ordered, you will have to print the confirmation form. And you can then collect the meal voucher and the physical toy in Dec 2013. (a) Nisha, the toy is about 2-3" tall depend on which minion. Check out youtube for more information....(b) The meal is fixed at $4.50, that mean, if you use your meal voucher for happy meal breakfast, the whole meal voucher is considered as consumed although the breakfast meal is cheaper, so plan how to use your voucher.......here is my notes:   https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=615696285129690&set=a.608747162491269.1073741826.608723972493588&type=1&relevant_count=1

Dunno y e officer hakim did not suggest to send in my order to e next nearest outlet.i den suggest that he can send my order to the outlet at jurong park which is juz opp jurong pt and is 24hrs.he say ok  but called bk 30mins later n say that the outlet already closed at 2am!! Doctor Lim Kai En!~ this video definitely remind me of my ambition when I was much younger :)

What a joke! You guys are running a campaign on love & grandparents (http://www.meetsharelove.com/) when one of your staff was particularly rude to my mine?

My 90 y'old grandma walked up to the counter and asked a staff for help to throw a cup away because she couldn't find the trash bin(she's 90% blind). YOUR STAFF, slammed the cup down in annoyance not once but twice because she had to do extra work. 

What kind of nonsensical service are you teaching your staff? I mean, she ordered a drink and instead of leaving the cup on the table for your staff to clean up, she did you a favor and brought it to you. Plus to react this way to an elderly? I'm pretty sure that's not what your current campaign is try to imply.

What do popular Ch 8 actress Paige Chua, Youtube personalities Dr Jiajia & Big Bro, and singer-songwriter Lorraine Tan have in common? They all love green Singapore! What’s there not to love?! To commemorate 50 years of Greening Singapore, the peeps at NParks produced a music video with special appearances by Paige, Dr Jiajia and Lorraine, as well as our lovely otters and hornbills! View and support green Singapore by sharing this with your friends! 

McDonald’s Singapore is proud to support 50 Years of Greening Singapore.

We’d like to think McDonald’s™ is more than just a restaurant. It’s a place where strangers become friends, and loved ones get closer. As part of Project Meet•Share•Love, we’re bringing together two very special people—children and their grandparents.
Visit mcdonalds.com.sg/meetsharelove to watch them as they share their lives with us, and each other, over a sweet McDonald's meal.
